content.webTitle: Driving ban for Eric Joyce MP, who refused to give breath test

fields.headline: Driving ban for Eric Joyce MP, who refused to give breath test
fields.bodyText: The Labour MP Eric Joyce was banned from driving for a year and fined £400 yesterday after an unexplained road incident near a petrochemical plant in Grangemouth. He had admitted failing to provide a breath sample. Falkirk sheriff court heard that guards at the Ineos plant called police after Joyce, the Falkirk MP and a former army major, approached the gatehouse at about 11.15pm on Thursday. The duty solicitor, Willie McIntyre, said that Joyce was embarrassed by the incident, adding that "his party is not going to be at all happy about what happened".
